article.description:
Olayinka Sanni scored 22 points and grabbed 15
rebounds to help No. 14 West Virginia beat St. John's 68-44 on
Saturday.
article.headline: Sanni's 22 points, 15 rebounds lead West Virginia past St. John's
article.linkText: West Virginia drops St. John's behind Sanni's 22
article.story:
NEW YORK (AP) -- Olayinka Sanni scored 22 points and grabbed 15 rebounds to help No. 14 West Virginia beat St. John's 68-44 on Saturday.

LaQuita Owens added 15 points and six rebounds for the Mountaineers (14-3, 4-1 Big East).

Joy McCorvey scored 10 points to lead St. John's (10-7, 1-3). Kia Wright, Sky Lindsay and Monique McLean combined to go 4-for-28 (14.3 percent) from the field.

Leading 44-38 with 15:04 left in the second half, West Virginia went on a 24-6 run to close out the game. The Mountaineers turned up their defense, holding St. John's without a field goal for over 8 minutes. McLean finally broke the drought with a layup at 6:58. By that point, the Red Storm were down 53-40. Meg Bulger answered with a 3-pointer to put the game away.

West Virginia led 32-24 with 2:34 left in the first half before St. John's went on an 8-3 run. Tiina Sten started the spurt with back-to-back layups.
